Compression socks are a great addition to your walking routine! Tracking your progress and staying motivated are crucial to achieving your fitness goals. Here are some tips to help you do just that:

1. **Fitbit App**: Use the Fitbit app to track your daily activity, including your walks and stretching routine. You can also set reminders to move and exercise throughout the day.
2. **Habit-tracking apps**: Apps like Habitica, HabitBull, or Loop Habit Tracker allow you to track your daily habits, including your stretching routine. You can set reminders, track your progress, and earn rewards for consistency.
3. **Journaling**: Keep a physical or digital journal to track your progress, note any changes in your body, and reflect on your feelings and motivations. Writing down your goals and progress can help you stay accountable and motivated.
4. **Progress photos**: Take progress photos at the beginning and end of each week to track visual changes in your body. This can be a great motivator, especially when you see changes in your flexibility and posture.
5. **Workout buddies**: Share your goals and progress with a friend or family member and ask them to hold you accountable. This can be a great way to stay motivated and inspired.
6. **Reward system**: Set small rewards for yourself when you reach certain milestones, such as completing a week of stretching or reaching a new step goal. Choose rewards that align with your goals, like a new workout outfit or a post-workout smoothie.
7. **Celebrate milestones**: Celebrate your progress along the way, no matter how small it may seem. This will help you stay motivated and encouraged to continue working towards your goals.
8. **Mix it up**: Vary your stretching routine every few weeks to avoid plateaus and keep things interesting. You can try new exercises, incorporate props like resistance bands or foam rollers, or focus on different muscle groups.
9. **Make it a habit**: Consistency is key. Try to perform your stretching routine at the same time every day, so it becomes an ingrained habit.
10. **Be kind to yourself**: Remember that it's okay to miss a day or two. Don't be too hard on yourself if you don't see immediate results. Focus on progress, not perfection, and celebrate small victories along the way.

By incorporating these tips into your routine, you'll be more likely to stay motivated and track your progress effectively. Good luck, and have fun with your new morning stretching routine!
